jobs.title: Business Development Coordinator
jobs.description:
Bellese is in the unique position of being both a longtime trusted partner to government agencies and also on the front line of modernizing government digital services for the people who use them. In turn, our client, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid, is on the vanguard of federal agencies for valuing and championing human-centered design, including service design. We are looking for a talented and thoughtful business development coordinator to help with company growth initiatives affecting the health outcomes and livelihoods of millions of Americans. 

 

The Business Development Coordinator will be heavily involved in coordinating and participating in proposal kick-off, strategy and review meetings, as well as overall proposal development. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, guiding a proposal from the RFP review stage to submission including proposal writing and response development. 

The ideal candidate has the ability to work well under strict deadlines in a fast-paced environment, direct and motivate work efforts of others, and handle stressful situations. This is an excellent opportunity for a person with a background in proposal preparation, digital service design challenge responses, and creation of presentations to mature their skills, new learn ones and help grow Bellese.

Responsibilities include: 

  • Coordination and development of proposals, statement of qualifications, and requests for information in response to commercial and government market segments. 
  • Support marketing and sales activities, including coordination and attendance at industry conferences.
  • Review and analyze RFP’s, RFI’s, and RFQ requests and participate in all phases of bid development including strategy development.
  • Proposal writing — draft original content and reviewing proposal drafts and final versions to ensure one voice, thoroughness, accuracy, financial considerations, quality, and effective design and layout
  • Facilitate meetings for proposal kick offs and color reviews.
  • Maintain, monitor, report growth metrics
  • Ensure high quality proposal responses while meeting all deadlines, manage all activities of proposal writing, and manage all other proposal responsibilities as required
  • Establish, distribute, and coordinate proposal schedules and drive progress towards established deadlines. 
  • Coordinate resources and track action items from internal reviews.  Interact with teammates to complete tasks while anticipating issues that will impact the schedule and necessary resources
  • Lead proposal reviews, coordinate comments and feedback from multiple stakeholders
  • Ensure proposal submissions are compliant and submitted on time
  • Perform proposal editing and writing activities to ensure proposal message consistency
  • Track, organize, and maintain project data and information.

Qualifications: 

  • 3+ years Proposal experience required.
  • Communication – Ability to apply effective facilitation techniques; Ability to communicate effectively using a variety of styles and techniques appropriate to the audience; Ability to effectively make presentations; Ability to listen effectively.
  • Oral Communication – Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates group presentation skills; Participates in meetings.
  • Written Communication – Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar, punctuation, and sentence structure to ensure that written materials prepared and reviewed are complete, succinct, and free of mechanical errors; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information. Knowledge of proper spelling, grammar, Skill to review and edit written materials.
  • Interpersonal Skills – Maintains confidentiality; Listens to others without interrupting; Keeps emotions under control; Remains open to others’ ideas and tries new things; Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships.
  • Teamwork – Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others’ views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; Supports everyone’s efforts to succeed.
  • Problem Solving – Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.
  • Planning/Organizing – Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently; Plans for additional resources; Sets goals and objectives;
  • Adaptability – Adapts to changes in the work environment; Manages competing demands; Changes approach or method to best fit the situation; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.Quality – Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Applies feedback to improve performance; Monitors own work to ensure quality.
  • Dependability – Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments; Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.
  • Reasoning Ability – Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

Education:

  • Bachelor’s (Required)

Writing challenge:

Using the Bellese website (bellese.io), write an executive summary about Bellese’s company culture, core competencies, brand and mission. 

 

Other:

  • U.S. citizen or legal right to work in the United States without sponsorship

Bellese Technologies, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.  In addition to federal law requirements, Bellese Technologies, LLC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

EEO is the law:

  • https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf

EEO is the Law Poster Supplement

  • https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf

Pay Transparency:

  • https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp_formattedESQA508c.pdf

jobs.title: Senior User Experience (UX) Researcher
jobs.description:
Bellese is in the unique position of being both a longtime trusted partner to government agencies and also on the front line of modernizing government digital services for the people who use them. In turn, our client, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid, is on the vanguard of federal agencies for valuing and championing human-centered design, including service design. We are looking for talented and thoughtful designers and researchers for multiple projects affecting the health outcomes and livelihoods of millions of Americans. You will work on initiatives, services, and applications to transform everything from policies to data flows to screens.

 

Your role:

  • Work with product owners and stakeholders to validate research hypotheses
  • Plan and conduct qualitative and quantitative research 
  • Find, recruit, and schedule research participants
  • Analyze research findings to create actionable insights and translate them into product features
  • Communicate research insights to product owners and stakeholders, contributing to the existing body of knowledge about users of CMS services and products

 

Qualifications:

  • At least 3 years of experience working as a researcher, service designer, or product designer, preferably in an enterprise environment
  • Ability to know which research methods to apply in which context, given product team goals and needs
  • Experience with qualitative and quantitative methods such as interviews, surveys, card sorting/tree testing, usability testing, etc.
  • Experience working with diverse product teams including business stakeholders, product owners, product managers, delivery managers, designers, developers, and other researchers
  • Excellent communication skills with clients, research participants, and teammates
  • Experience balancing business goals, user needs, and project constraints
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Deeply curious and collaborative mindset
  • You value outcomes more than the tools used to produce outcomes

Desired skills:

  • Deep understanding of web accessibility

 

Other:

  • U.S. citizen or legal right to work in the United States without sponsorship

Bellese Technologies, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.  In addition to federal law requirements, Bellese Technologies, LLC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

EEO is the law:

  • https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf

EEO is the Law Poster Supplement

  • https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf

Pay Transparency:

  • https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp_formattedESQA508c.pdf

jobs.title: User Experience (UX) Designer
jobs.description:
Bellese is in the unique position of being both a longtime trusted partner to government agencies and also on the front line of modernizing government digital services for the people who use them. In turn, our client, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid, is on the vanguard of federal agencies for valuing and championing human-centered design, including service design. We are looking for talented and thoughtful designers and researchers for multiple projects affecting the health outcomes and livelihoods of millions of Americans.

Your role:

The UX designer is responsible for helping to translate user research into product designs and contribute to the service design of complex problems. You will collaborate with team members in coordination with the UX/HCD Design Lead to produce design solutions throughout design iterations.

  • Participate in design strategy and service design discussions from project inception through to iterative testing and release of designs you create
  • Follow a human-centered design approach through rapid testing and design iterations
  • Participate in developing an understanding of user needs to develop software specifications for development teams, addressing the end-to-end experience
  • Plan for and document information architecture through artifacts such as sitemaps
  • Build responsive design artifacts (including mobile) for wireframe and prototype testing
  • Participate in mapping user journeys needs from start to finish
  • Contribute to design systems as appropriate
  • Work in an agile environment, delivering incremental product functionality in short iterations

Qualifications:

  • Experience in UX design software such as Sketch, InVision, Figma, and others
  • Experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions
  • Understanding of mobile-first and responsive design
  • Experience with information architecture
  • Ability to solve problems while considering timeliness, effectiveness, and practicality in addressing product needs
  • Ability to perform workflow research and analysis and define future state user journeys
  • Ability to analyze and define navigation flows and data layouts
  • Experience developing user persona specifications
  • Ability to develop usability test plans, tests and facilitate usability testing sessions
  • Possess strong attention to detail
  • Demonstrate strong collaboration and inter-team skills; ability to listen and consider input from team members
  • Basic understanding of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript

Desired skills:

  • 5+ years of UX design experience, preferably in an enterprise environment
  • Strong ability to effectively communicate design decisions
  • Experience working with users, product owners, design and development teams
  • Experience with government digital services

Other:

  • U.S. citizen or legal right to work in the United States without sponsorship

Bellese Technologies, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.  In addition to federal law requirements, Bellese Technologies, LLC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

  • https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Full-Stack
jobs.description:
This is a software engineering job to develop, implement and maintain modern software solutions. The software engineer will work as part of a product team of business and QA analysts, and other software engineers to implement healthcare related software solution using modern tech stacks and platforms.  

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.
  • Develop and maintain API specifications using Swagger Editor.
  • Develop new features using the API first design approach
  • Develop new features using acceptance test-driven development
  • Work in and with small feature delivery teams: cross-functional, cross-component team that completes many end-to-end customer features, one by one.
  • Participate in product strategy, product design and product development activities.
  • Use lean and agile work management and engineering practices.
  • Manage project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.
  • Ability to implement test automation framework
  • Ability to automate non-functional tests, including performance, security, and accessibility

Technical Qualifications:

  • Required:
    • Experience working with the following programming languages
      • Go
      • React
      • JavaScript
    • Experience working with more than one of the following test automation tools:
      • FitNesse
      • NUnit
      • JMeter
      • Cucumber
      • Katalon
      • SoapUI
    • Experience working with the following:
      • web application development
      • unix/linux environments
      • developing large scale systems and API services
      • secured REST-based API endpoints
      • Acceptance and Unit Testing
  • Recommended
    • Experience working with the following programming languages
      • Python
      • Java
      • C/C++
      • SQL/ No-SQL scripting
      • Terraform
      • Cloudformation
      • Groovy
    • Experience working with the following:
      • AWS
      • Cloudbees Jenkins or another similar CI/CD pipeline tool
      • Working knowledge of Section 508 and WCAG accessibility standards
      • security software development
      • Splunk
      • global infrastructure, virtual clouds, virtual computing, serverless computing
      • load balancing and networking
      • data storage and data streaming
      • Security
      • Trunk-based development
      • Feature flagging
      • Continuous Integration/ Continuous Delivery

General Qualifications:

  • Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English.
  • Curious with a passion for continuous learning.
  • U.S. citizen or legal right to work in the United States without sponsorship.

 

Bellese Technologies, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.  In addition to federal law requirements, Bellese Technologies, LLC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

EEO is the law:

  • https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf

EEO is the Law Poster Supplement

  • https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf

Pay Transparency:

  • https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp_formattedESQA508c.pdf

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Infrastructure Hybrid
jobs.description:
This is a software engineering job to develop, implement and maintain modern software APIs and supporting infrastructure solutions. The software engineer will work as part of a product team of business and QA analysts, and other software engineers to implement healthcare related software solution using modern tech stacks and platforms.  

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software and cloud-based infrastructure.
  • Develop and maintain API specifications using Swagger Editor.
  • Develop new features using the API first design approach
  • Develop new features using acceptance test-driven development
  • Work in and with small feature delivery teams: cross-functional, cross-component team that completes many end-to-end customer features, one by one.
  • Participate in product strategy, product design and product development activities.
  • Use lean and agile work management and engineering practices.
  • Manage project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.

Technical Qualifications:

  • Required:
    • Experience working with the following programming languages
      • Go
      • Terraform
      • CloudFormation
    • Experience working with the following:
      • AWS
      • Cloudbees Jenkins or another similar CI/CD pipeline tool
      • Splunk
      • global infrastructure, virtual clouds, virtual computing, serverless computing
      • load balancing and networking
      • data storage and data streaming
      • web application development
      • unix/linux environments
      • distributed systems
      • security software development
      • developing large scale systems and API services
      • secured REST-based API endpoints
      • Acceptance and Unit Testing
  • Recommended
    • Experience working with one or more of the following programming languages
      • Python
      • Java
      • C/C++
      • SQL/ No-SQL scripting
      • React
      • JavaScript
      • Groovy
      • Ansible, Chef or Puppet
    • Experience working with more than one of the following test automation tools:
      • FitNesse
      • NUnit
      • JMeter
      • Cucumber
      • Katalon
      • SoapUI
    • Experience working with the following:
      • Docker
      • NewRelic
      • Akamai
      • Kong
      • API Gateways
      • Security
      • Trunk-based development
      • Feature flagging
      • Continuous Integration/ Continuous Delivery

General Qualifications:

  • Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English.
  • Curious with a passion for continuous learning.
  • U.S. citizen or legal right to work in the United States without sponsorship.

Bellese Technologies, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.  In addition to federal law requirements, Bellese Technologies, LLC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.
